item.title: How to Migrate from Amazon MSF
item.description:
Note
 This post originally appeared on the Decodable blog.

Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink (MSF) is one of several providers of hosted Flink. As my colleague Gunnar Morling described in his recent article , it can be used to run a Flink job that youâ€™ve written in Java or Python (PyFlink). But did you know that this isnâ€™t the only wayâ€”or perhaps even the best wayâ€”to have your Flink jobs run for you?

item.title: Decodable vs. Amazon MSF: Getting Started with Flink SQL
item.description:
Note
 This post originally appeared on the Decodable blog.

One of the things that I love about SQL is the power that it gives you to work with data in a declarative manner. I want this thingâ€¦go do it. How should it do it? Well thatâ€™s the problem for the particular engine, not me. As a language with a pedigree of multiple decades and no sign of waning (despite a wobbly patch for some whilst NoSQL figured out they actually wanted to be NewSQL ðŸ˜‰), itâ€™s the lingua franca of data systems.
